pr_title: Error on excessively large code generation

timeline.message:
Prevent ASM library causing worker GC storms.

ASM ClassWriter has two modes - COMPUTE_MAXS, COMPUTE_FRAMES. The first one is really fast but the second is super expensive and can end up using a lot of memory for situations where it was going to fail anyway. So we first do a call with COMPUTE_MAXS to get any errors out quickly and this will help in not causing the GC storms and worker crahses.

timeline.bodyText: Can we have this throw some bytecode specific exception and catch that in presto-main so we don't need to introduce dependency to spi in bytecode? presto-bytecode should be a pretty low level independent package.
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: too many places. I guess we need big refactoring :(
replies.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: OK moved it CompilerUtils and handling it there.
replies.author: kaikalur

timeline.bodyText:
If you unwrap looking for a specific exception you should keep going until you find it and not just one level.
I think maybe you want to wrap in a new PrestoException with the contents of the wrapped PrestoException.
You lose less (admittedly not that important) information that way.
timeline.author: aweisberg

replies.bodyText: I was hoping none wraps PrestoException in another PrestoException.
replies.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: I was hoping none wraps PrestoException in another PrestoException. Also I'm just mimicking the previous catch PrestoException. I have seen that pattern a few places - if you get PrestoException you just throw it again.
replies.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: So I reverted back to the old code as the flow doesn't seem to be relevant for user queries. We still block it but the message is different.
replies.author: kaikalur

timeline.message:
Prevent ASM library causing worker GC storms.

So we first do a call with COMPUTE_MAXS to get any errors out quickly and this will help in not causing the GC storms and worker crahses.

timeline.bodyText: What's the point of this code? I think you want to catch ByteCodeTooLargeException?
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: Oh i see you did that in CompilerUtils so this should not be needed?
replies.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: So if I don't have it here, it's not getting surfaced as user error. It will become COMPILER_ERROR which we don't want
replies.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: what? why? that doesn't make sense? Why catching and rethrow it would change the error type?
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: This is not needed if you already handles the exception in the other method?
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: both were public so I just added it :) now removed.
replies.author: kaikalur
